creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: could be the right panel of a diptych
inscription: right yellow rectangular: {Iwai Kumesaburō as Shirakuben no shi??}; red rectangular: {Onoe Eizaburō as Tsujiura no Omachi}; left yellow rectangular: {Ichimura Uzaemon as Karasaki no ??matsu}; Probably a prologue or advertising copy for the play: {Kenbutsu} (the play) {wa, bando_ ichi} (the best in the eastern provinces or Edo area) {no futari??. Oto no kikoe shi Kinokuniya, Yamatoya Sawamura} (these three are nicknames of the actors). {Kenbutsu wa mutsuki} (January) {futsuka} (second) {no maizome ni....}
markings: Censor: Kai+Boar 10; Publisher: Etsuka (assumed to be Echizenya Kahei, details unknown); Carver: Asakura Horiman
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
title: Iwai Kumesaburō IV, Onoe Eizburō IV and Ichimura Uzaemon XIV in their Roles
